results.description: Enable wins the top honour at racing's Cartier Awards while jockey Pat Smullen, who is being treated for pancreatic cancer, is also recognised.
results.shortTitle: Enable voted Horse of the Year
results.title: Enable voted Horse of the Year at Cartier Awards; jockey Pat Smullen honoured

results.description: More than 30 people were involved in widespread fighting, the CPS says.
results.shortTitle: Nine jailed over racecourse brawl
results.title: Goodwood racecourse brawl: Nine jailed

results.description: Horse racing in Hong Kong is rocked by a corruption scandal with 21 people arrested as part of a crackdown on illegal betting.
results.shortTitle: Stable staff arrested in Hong Kong probe
results.title: Hong Kong betting inquiry: Racing staff among 21 arrests in Operation Iron Triangle

results.description: Give Me A Copper, part-owned by ex-Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson, wins the Badger Beers Silver Trophy at Wincanton.
results.shortTitle: Ferguson horse given Grand National target
results.title: Give Me A Copper provides part-owner Sir Alex Ferguson with Wincanton win

thumbnail.altText: Former Manchester United manager Sir Alex Ferguson

results.description: A jockey's "lenient" ban for marking a racehorse by using a whip with elastic bands prompts British racing to review penalties for such offences.
results.shortTitle: 'Elastic band' whip prompts review
results.title: Danny Brock: Review planned after jockey marked horse with 'elastic band' whip

results.description: Frankie Dettori says he wants to cry after his narrow Melbourne Cup defeat on Master Of Reality and subsequent demotion and ban.
results.shortTitle: I want to cry - demoted Dettori
results.title: Melbourne Cup 2019: Frankie Dettori says 'I want to cry' after defeat and demotion

results.description: Vow And Declare wins for Australian trainer Danny O'Brien while jockey Frankie Dettori is banned as runner-up Master Of Reality is demoted to fourth.
results.shortTitle: Dettori demoted as Vow And Declare wins Melbourne Cup
results.title: Melbourne Cup 2019: Vow And Declare wins; Frankie Dettori banned as runner-up Master Of Reality demoted

results.description: The slaughter of racehorses has shocked many Australians as the nation holds its most famous race.
results.shortTitle: Australia revulsed by horse cruelty scandals
results.title: Melbourne Cup: Will Australian racing overcome cruelty scandals?

results.description: Preview as Cross Counter seeks second British success in race 'that stops a nation' - an event under pressure over welfare concerns.

results.description: Mongolian Groom becomes the 37th horse to die since December 2018 following injury at California's Santa Anita track, overshadowing the Breeders' Cup meeting.

results.description: Diego Du Charmil wins at Ascot despite dislodging a plastic wing, while a member of the Ascot groundstaff escapes a collision with the leading pack in the feature race.

results.title: Ascot: Final-fence drama and near collision on eventful afternoon

results.description: Ballyoptic, trained by Nigel Twiston-Davies and ridden by his son Sam, wins the Charlie Hall Chase at Wetherby.

results.title: Charlie Hall Chase: Ballyoptic wins after favourite La Bague Au Roi pulls up

results.description: Kameko runs out a convincing winner of the rescheduled Vertem Futurity Trophy - the first Group One race to be run on an all-weather track in Britain.

results.description: Khadijah Mellah is an 18-year-old from Peckham who made history. In July, she became the first British Muslim woman to ride in a horse race.

results.description: Trainer Mark Johnston breaks the record for most British Flat racing winners in a calendar year with Bavardages bringing his 236th victory of 2019.
